Open topic with navigation

Diagnostic Console

Start Page

Ribbon: Diagnostics & XCP Tab|Diagnostic Console

The Diagnostic Console makes it possible to send single diagnostic requests directly to an ECU and receive and analyze the corresponding response messages.

Note

Please note that, after every sending of a request, all responses are signaled only to the sender. Diagnostic requests that are sent from the Diagnostic Console are thus invisible for a CAPL program as are the received responses. Similarly, no responses to requests sent from a CAPL program are displayed in the Diagnostic Console.

The feature User-defined messages allows you to preconfigure existing diagnostic requests with your own parameter values and save such requests under a meaningful name. If you are e.g. using the same service in different scenarios with varying parameter values, you may now access the adequate service immediately and without the need for additional manual modifications.

Note

For services used for unlocking an ECU you need to add a Seed & Key DLL file to the configuration. See page Diagnostic Layer.

Furthermore with user-defined messages requests can be sent cyclically from the Diagnostic Console.

Note

To work with diagnostic description that have been created with a newer version of CANdela Studio, the newest converters must be downloaded from the Vector homepage under
https://vector.com/persistors
in the section "CANdelaStudio -> Add-ons/Freeware". The accompanying "Read me" files have installation instructions.

Alternatively see CDD Diagnostic Descriptions.

To send diagnostic requests to an ECU the appropriate diagnostic description in format (CDD, ODX or MDX) must be located in the working directory or a Basic Diagnostic ECU must be configured.

Note

In case of functional addressing a diagnostic request is sent to all physically ECU's and the respective responses are received and assigned to the device that have sent them.

After loading the diagnostic descriptions a Diagnostic Console is automatically opened, if the diagnostic description (CDD/ODX) has been assigned to a bus or a bus node ([Configure…] button) or a Basic Diagnostic ECU has been configured on this network/bus. When a diagnostic description is configured as functional group requests, a specific Diagnostic Console is opened, that allows you to send functional requests to all ECUs and to display the collection of all answers.

  • Symbolic
    The response messages are displayed in symbolic form ("text in clear")
  • Raw Values
    The response messages are displayed in hexadecimal form. In this setting the parameter values can be input in raw hex format.
  • [Execute/Stop]
    Clicking this button sends the request message to the ECU.
    Starts/stops the cyclical sending in case of a user-defined message which has a cycle time defined.

Note

Data_Packet requests of the type ReadScheduleFast trigger the ECU to send an endless response stream that causes a timeout. Although the timeout message is closed by clicking the [OK] button, the ECU continues sending until a request message of the type StopScheduleSending is sent to the ECU.
  • Switch On / Switch Off Tester Present
    Tester Present requests are sent periodical to the ECU. Tester Present is a message sent cyclically to maintain communication with the ECU. With this button you can start or stop the sending of this messages. The status is also valid for the Fault Memory Window.

In the right corner of the symbol tray near the "Online/Offline" indicator is a "LED" situated that shows the Tester Present behavior:

  • Gray: no TesterPresent send
  • Yellow: send TesterPresent
  • Green: received response message
  • Red: transmit error/timeout

Note

Tester Present requests can only be sent when the ECU is in the online state.
  • Display Vehicle System Groups / Diagnostic Classes
    Switches between the VSG and the Diagnostic Class view (VSG: "Vehicle System Groups", system groups of the ECU). This groups are displayed in a different color.

VSGs are an alternative display of the available diagnostic services. Several system groups can be freely defined in the CANdela description file. Since a link to the diagnostic instances can be assigned to them, logical groups can be defined.

Note

This option is only active when VSGs are defined in the ECU. VSGs can only be created and edited in the CANdela Studio.
The option is only available for databases of type *.cdd and *.pdx, not for *.odx databases.
  • Display Request History
    Displays the history of the requests. You can select a request from the list and send it again with the [Execute] button.

Note

This option is only available via the toolbar. The number of requests in the list can be set in the Properties dialog.
  • Initialize Parameter
    Initializes the parameters of the current write service.
  • Clear Trace Area
    This button deletes the content of the Trace area (the lower part of the Diagnostic Console)
  • Activate/deactivate trace logging
    When this option is activated, a selection dialog appears for the logging file. The name of the logging file is set in the Properties dialog.
  • Search
  • Create user-defined message
    Creates a user-defined message from the diagnostic request currently selected in the tree view. For this message a name and - if needed – a cycle time can be entered. If the request is not to be sent cyclically, please select ---- in the Message cycle field.
  • Delete user-defined message
    Deletes the user-defined message currently selected in the tree view.
  • Edit user-defined message
    Opens the user-defined message currently selected in the tree view for modification of its name and cycle time.
  • Start macro recording
  • Stop macro recording
  • Replay last recorded macro
  • Store lastly recorded macro as script
  • Delete macro
  • Open Properties dialog

Raw Telegrams

  • Add raw values
    This button is displayed in the service tree [Raw Telegrams|Add raw values] besides the parameter value. Clicking it allows you to insert the current raw message into the service tree.
  • Delete raw values
    This button is displayed in the service tree [Raw Telegrams] besides the parameter value when a raw message is selected. Clicking it allows you to remove the current raw message from the service tree.

You can input a complete raw message (e.g. '18 00 ff 00') into the combination box (with a dropdown menu) of the Diagnostic Console. To send this message, click the [Execute] button.

Note

Symbolic string table parameter values cannot be modified in the Diagnostic Console GUI, the values can only be selected.

The last sent messages are stored and can be called and sent once more. After you have closed the program the last 10 messages stay stored.

Comments can be added to a message by using "#".

Note

  • Also, each entered parameter value is now checked immediately. If there are invalid values an error message appears:
    ERROR Parameter value invalid!
  • Cyclic periodic responses are only displayed in the Trace Window not in the Diagnostic Console.
  • Data_Packet requests of the type ReadScheduleFast trigger the ECU to send an endless response stream that causes a timeout.
    Although the timeout message is closed by clicking the [OK] button, the ECU continues sending until a request message of the type StopScheduleSending was sent to the ECU.
